definitions: man who is about to be married or has just gotten married
person who takes care of horses by feeding, cleaning, and brushing them
examples: The groom waited nervously at the altar for his bride
The photographer captured the groom's reaction when he first saw his bride
The stable groom brushed the champion horse before the race
She worked as a groom at the equestrian center for years

definitions: act of cleaning and maintaining one's appearance or that of an animal
process of building trust with someone to manipulate or abuse them
regular cleaning and maintenance of animals' coats and appearance
examples: Daily grooming helps maintain good personal hygiene and confidence
The cat spent hours grooming herself in the sunny window
Online grooming of minors is a serious criminal offense
Parents should educate children about grooming behaviors from strangers
Professional grooming keeps pets healthy and comfortable year-round
The dog grooming salon offers nail trimming and fur styling

definitions: long narrow cut or depression in a hard surface
rhythmic pattern in music that creates a compelling beat
comfortable routine or pattern of behavior one settles into
examples: The vinyl record had a deep groove that caused it to skip
Water carved grooves into the rock face over thousands of years
The bass player laid down a funky groove for the band
Everyone started dancing when the DJ found the perfect groove
After vacation, it took time to get back into the work groove
She finally found her groove with the new exercise routine

definitions: decorative style in art featuring strange human and animal forms
something that is ugly or distorted in an unnatural way
examples: The cathedral featured grotesque carvings on its stone facade
Medieval grotesque art often combined human and animal features
The accident left grotesque scars across his face
The horror movie used grotesque special effects to frighten viewers

definitions: small natural cave, especially one that is picturesque or has interesting features
artificial structure made to resemble a cave, often used as a garden feature
examples: The blue grotto glowed with ethereal light from the water
Explorers discovered ancient paintings inside the limestone grotto
The garden grotto provided a cool retreat during summer afternoons
They built a grotto with a waterfall beside the swimming pool

definitions: ceremony marking the start of construction on a new building
something innovative that introduces new ideas or methods
examples: The mayor attended the groundbreaking for the new hospital wing
They scheduled the groundbreaking ceremony for early spring
Her groundbreaking research changed how we understand climate change
The company's groundbreaking technology revolutionized smartphone design

definitions: large North American rodent that hibernates in winter and emerges in early February
examples: The groundhog emerged from its burrow on Groundhog Day
Groundhogs can cause damage to gardens by eating vegetables

definitions: connection of electrical equipment to the earth for safety
punishment where a child is restricted to home as discipline
solid foundation of knowledge or experience in a subject
examples: Proper grounding prevents electrical shocks and equipment damage
The electrician checked the grounding before installing the outlet
Her grounding lasted two weeks after she broke curfew
The teenager faced grounding for using the car without permission
His grounding in classical music helped him compose film scores
A solid grounding in mathematics is essential for engineering students

definitions: plant that produces edible seeds underground, commonly known as peanuts
examples: Farmers harvest groundnuts by pulling the entire plant from soil
Groundnut oil is widely used for cooking in many countries

definitions: person responsible for maintaining the grounds of a property, park, or sports facility
examples: The groundskeeper mowed the baseball field before every home game
Our school groundskeeper keeps the campus looking beautiful year-round

definitions: person who maintains sports fields, especially cricket pitches and football grounds
examples: The groundsman prepared the cricket pitch for the test match
An experienced groundsman knows how weather affects field conditions

definitions: preliminary or basic work that provides a foundation for something more substantial
examples: She laid the groundwork for the project during months of research
The treaty established groundwork for lasting peace between nations

definitions: large heavy-bodied fish found in warm seas, popular as food
examples: The diver photographed a massive grouper hiding in the coral reef
Grilled grouper is a popular dish at seaside restaurants

definitions: person who follows a music group or celebrity with extreme devotion
examples: The band's groupies waited outside the venue after every concert
She was a groupie who collected memorabilia from her favorite musicians

definitions: number of things or people that are located, gathered, or classed together
examples: The teacher created small groupings of students for the project
A grouping of wildflowers grew beside the garden path

definitions: medium to large game bird with feathered legs found in northern regions
persistent complaint or grumble about something
examples: Hunters prize grouse for their challenging flight patterns
The grouse's mating dance is a spectacular display in spring
His constant grouse about the weather annoyed his coworkers
She had a legitimate grouse about the poor service

definitions: thin mortar used for filling spaces between tiles or masonry
examples: The bathroom tiles needed new grout after years of moisture damage
Apply grout carefully to avoid staining the tile surface

definitions: small group of trees without undergrowth, especially fruit or nut trees
examples: The orange grove stretched for acres under the California sun
They picnicked in a shady grove beside the river

definitions: person or company that grows plants, especially crops, commercially
examples: The tomato grower supplied fresh produce to local restaurants
Small growers often sell directly to consumers at farmers markets

definitions: low guttural sound made by animals or humans expressing hostility
examples: The dog's growl warned strangers to keep their distance
His stomach let out a loud growl during the quiet meeting

definitions: soft thick wormlike larva of certain insects, especially beetles
informal term for food
examples: Birds search for grubs in the lawn after rain
The fishing bait shop sold containers of fresh grubs
Let's grab some grub before the movie starts
The diner serves hearty grub at reasonable prices

definitions: persistent feeling of ill will or resentment from a past insult or injury
examples: She held a grudge against her former business partner for years
Learning to let go of grudges improves mental health

definitions: style of rock music featuring a dirty guitar sound and lazy vocals
dirt, grime, or other filthy matter
examples: Seattle became the center of the grunge music scene in the 1990s
Grunge fashion included flannel shirts and ripped jeans
Years of grunge had accumulated in the abandoned warehouse
He scrubbed the grunge off the kitchen walls

definitions: short low sound made by an animal or person
slang term for a low-ranking soldier, especially in infantry
examples: The weightlifter let out a grunt as he lifted the barbell
Pigs communicate through various grunts and squeals
The old grunt shared war stories with younger soldiers
Military grunts often carry the heaviest equipment loads

definitions: legendary creature with the head and wings of an eagle and body of a lion
examples: The ancient coin depicted a gryphon guarding royal treasure
Gryphons appear frequently in medieval heraldry and architecture

definitions: accumulated excrement of seabirds or bats used as fertilizer
examples: Farmers prized guano as a natural fertilizer rich in nitrogen
The cave floor was covered with centuries of bat guano

definitions: person who gives a guarantee or promises to pay another person's debt
examples: His parents acted as guarantors for his first apartment lease
The bank required a guarantor before approving the business loan

definitions: building used to accommodate guards or as a military detention facility
examples: Soldiers checked passes at the guardhouse before allowing entry
The old guardhouse now serves as a visitor information center

definitions: position of being legally responsible for the care of someone unable to manage their own affairs
examples: The court granted guardianship of the children to their grandmother
Guardianship requires making important decisions about healthcare and finances

definitions: rail that prevents people or vehicles from falling or going into dangerous areas
examples: The mountain road had sturdy guardrails along steep drop-offs
Children held onto the guardrail while walking down the stairs

definitions: soldier who is a member of a guard unit, especially ceremonial guards
examples: The Queen's guardsman stood motionless despite tourist distractions
Each guardsman undergoes rigorous training before ceremonial duties

definitions: tropical fruit with sweet pink or white flesh and edible seeds
examples: Fresh guava juice is a popular beverage in tropical countries
The guava tree produces fruit twice yearly in warm climates

definitions: member of a small independent group fighting against larger regular forces
examples: Guerilla fighters used hit-and-run tactics against the occupying army
The guerilla movement gained support from rural communities

definitions: member of a small independent group taking part in irregular fighting
examples: Guerrilla warfare relies on mobility and knowledge of local terrain
The guerrilla forces operated from hidden mountain bases

definitions: process of estimating or concluding something without sufficient information
examples: Guessing the answer won't help you learn the material properly
Weather forecasting involves educated guessing based on data patterns

definitions: small hotel or private house offering paid accommodation to travelers
examples: The cozy guesthouse provided breakfast and local travel advice
They converted their spare cottage into a profitable guesthouse

definitions: book of information about a place for visitors or tourists
examples: The guidebook recommended several hidden restaurants in the city
She always travels with a guidebook to learn about local history

definitions: medieval association of craftsmen or merchants with mutual interests and standards
examples: The guild set quality standards for all member craftsmen
Modern writers' guilds protect authors' rights and interests

definitions: building where a guild or corporation meets or formerly met
examples: The medieval guildhall still hosts civic ceremonies today
Merchants gathered at the guildhall to discuss trade regulations

definitions: sly or cunning intelligence used to deceive or trick others
examples: The con artist used guile to separate victims from their money
Political success often requires a combination of charm and guile

definitions: machine with a heavy blade used for beheading people
device with a blade for cutting paper
examples: The guillotine became a symbol of the French Revolution
Museums display guillotines as reminders of historical justice systems
The office guillotine cuts through stacks of paper cleanly
Use the guillotine carefully to avoid injury to fingers

definitions: former British gold coin worth 21 shillings
short form of guinea pig or guinea fowl
examples: Antique dealers still price some items in guineas for tradition
A guinea was considered more genteel than a pound
The guinea ran around its cage squeaking for attention
Wild guinea fowl are common in African grasslands

definitions: external appearance or form, especially when misleading about true nature
examples: The scammer approached victims under the guise of charity work
Wolves in sheep's guise appear throughout folklore and literature

definitions: person who plays the guitar, especially as a profession
examples: The lead guitarist's solo brought the crowd to their feet
She worked as a session guitarist for various recording artists

definitions: system of Soviet labor camps and detention facilities for political prisoners
examples: Millions suffered in the gulag system during Stalin's rule
Survivors wrote memoirs describing harsh gulag conditions

definitions: narrow ravine marking the course of a stream
examples: Prospectors searched for gold in the rocky gulch
Flash floods can turn a dry gulch into a raging torrent

definitions: long-winged web-footed seabird typically having white and gray plumage
examples: Gulls circled the fishing boat hoping for discarded catch
The beach was filled with the cries of hungry gulls

definitions: water-worn ravine or small valley created by running water
examples: Heavy rains carved a deep gully through the hillside
Children were warned not to play near the gully's edge

definitions: flavored substance for chewing
firm tissue that surrounds the bases of teeth
sticky substance from certain trees
examples: She always chewed gum to freshen her breath after meals
The teacher confiscated gum from students during class
Regular flossing helps maintain healthy gums and prevent disease
His gums bled when he brushed too vigorously
Eucalyptus gum has medicinal properties used in cough drops
The tree's gum sealed the wound in its bark
